author: Christian Terry
title: How to show your support on National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day
text:
HOUSTON – This Tuesday is National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day.
The day falls on the 9th of January every year. It is a day where we honor those who have dedicated their lives to the safety and security of our communities.
The day was created in 2015 as a way to express gratitude for officers in the United States. It was created following a series of events in 2014, when a police officer was involved in a shooting in Missouri.
The backlash after the event led the national organization C.O.P.S. (Concerns of Police Survivors) to work to change the negative portrayal of police officers in the news to a positive one. The day also raises awareness about the difficult decisions police officers have to make
“In light of recent negativity directed toward law enforcement nationally, there is a need to show law enforcement officers that our citizens recognize the difficult and sometimes impossible career they have chosen, in public service to us all,” the organization says.
There are several ways you can show your support for law enforcement on Tuesday.
_
The organization C.O.P.S. shared different ways you can show your support.
They encourage people to wear blue in support of law enforcement. You can also send a card of support to your local police department or state agency.
The organization also encourages people to share a story about a positive law enforcement experience on social media.
You can find other ways to show your support for law enforcement here.
